title: Fancy dress funerals
intro: Funerals are sad occasions but some people decide to turn them into joyful celebrations of the dead person's life. Rob and Neil talk about fancy dress funerals and teach you six items of useful vocabulary in this episode of 6 Minute English.
this_week_question: According to a UK survey, how many of us would like our funerals to be more of a party or celebration? Is it…
Listen to the programme to find out the answer.

vocab.desc: a ceremony we hold for a dead person
a formal event performed on special occasions – like a wedding, a graduation or a funeral
special clothes you wear to an event to look like a famous person or character from a movie, for example
a set of clothes you wear to look like somebody else
to make a big effort to get carried away (phrasal verb) to get very excited and lose control of your feelings

transcript.author: Neil
transcript.text: Hello, I'm Neil and welcome to 6 Minute English, where today we bring you a serious topic and six items of vocabulary.

transcript.author: Rob
transcript.text: And hello, I'm Rob. Now, here's a serious question for you, Neil. Have you thought about what you'd like to happen when you die?

transcript.author: Neil
transcript.text: Interesting way to start the show, Rob… No, I haven't.

transcript.author: Rob
transcript.text: Well, nobody really likes to talk about death, do they?

transcript.author: Neil
transcript.text: Well, it isn't a fun topic. So, can we talk about something else, please?

transcript.author: Rob
transcript.text: Afraid not. Because today's topic is funerals – a funeral is a ceremony we hold for a dead person.

transcript.author: Neil
transcript.text: And a ceremony is a formal event performed on special occasions – like a wedding or a graduation – or in this case, a funeral.

transcript.author: Rob
transcript.text: OK. Well, let's start with a quiz question. According to a UK survey, how many of us would like our funerals to be more of a party or celebration? Is it… a) 5%, b) 25% or c) 50%?

transcript.author: Neil
transcript.text: Well, I think it's 25%. I hadn't thought about it before – but I'd definitely prefer my funeral to be a celebration. With my favourite music playing – and definitely nobody wearing black…

transcript.author: Rob
transcript.text: Well, strangely enough, a friend of mine went to a funeral recently where the funeral director was dressed as Darth Vader from Star Wars!

transcript.author: Neil
transcript.text: Hmm. That sounds wrong. But I guess people are choosing to move away from the traditional funeral – you know, in church, people dressed in black, all very quiet…

transcript.author: Rob
transcript.text: Darth Vader does wear black, at least! Anyway, let's hear from Shonnie Sullivan here in the UK talking about the fancy dress funeral she and her sister organized for their mother.

transcript.author: INSERT
transcript.text: Shonnie : It was quite unusual as we turned up in fancy dress. Interviewer : Had your mum left instructions about how she wanted her funeral to be? Shonnie :Only that we don't cry, and we… to have a party to celebrate her life. Be happy, don't be sad… I was a witch. Interviewer : How did you look? Shonnie : Oh, it was just a little black dress and I just had, like, a little fancy witch hat on – the same as my sister. And we had a very close friend of the family come as Beetlejuice – which was absolutely amazing. He really did go all out for that.

transcript.author: Rob
transcript.text: So fancy dress - special clothes you wear to an event – to look like a famous person or character from a movie. Another word we use is costume – which is a set of clothes you wear to look like somebody else.

transcript.author: Neil
transcript.text: Shonnie and her sister chose a Halloween theme for the funeral and wore witches' costumes – little black dresses with special hats.

transcript.author: Rob
transcript.text: A close family relative dressed as Beetlejuice … Did he dress as a squashed insect, Neil? I'm confused here!

transcript.author: Neil
transcript.text: No, Rob. He dressed as Beetlejuice, the main character in a popular 1980s movie. Beetlejuice is a ghost who wears crazy clothes, and has scary hair and make up.

transcript.author: Rob
transcript.text: Hmm. I haven't seen the film. But what does Shonnie mean when she says her relative went ‘all out' with his costume?

transcript.author: Neil
transcript.text: To go all out means to make a big effort – and this guy's costume involved not only special clothes, but special hair and make up too.

transcript.author: Rob
transcript.text: Like me.

transcript.author: Neil
transcript.text: What do you mean, 'like me'?

transcript.author: Rob
transcript.text: Well, I go all out to get my clothes and hair just right for 6 Minute English.

transcript.author: Neil
transcript.text: Yes, and, well... you look great, Rob. But unfortunately nobody sees us… do they?

transcript.author: Rob
transcript.text: Yes, good point. But it's important to make an effort.

transcript.author: Neil
transcript.text: So have you had any thoughts about the sort of funeral you would like to have?

transcript.author: Rob
transcript.text: Oooh… Yes, I like the thought of my friends and family saying their final goodbyes to me on a beach with a beautiful sunset, listening to Stairway to Heaven by Led Zeppelin…

transcript.author: Neil
transcript.text: OK, well, before you get too carried away with ideas for your own funeral, let's have the answer to today's quiz question.

transcript.author: Rob
transcript.text: To get carried away means to get very excited and lose control of your feelings! I never thought I would get excited about my own funeral… But anyway – yes, back to today's question! How many of us would like our funerals to be more of a party or celebration? Is it… a) 5%, b) 25%, or c) 50%?

transcript.author: Neil
transcript.text: And I said 25%.

transcript.author: Rob
transcript.text: No, it's actually 50%. The market research company ICN found that half of us here in the UK would prefer something different to the traditional funeral.

transcript.author: Neil
transcript.text: More than I expected.OK, shall we look back at the words we have learned today?

transcript.author: Rob
transcript.text: Yes. First up – 'funeral' – a ceremony we hold for a dead person. The plural is funerals – "Fancy dress funerals aren't everybody's cup of tea." The adjective is – funereal – notice the stress on the second syllable – "Who chose this funereal music? Can we change it to something more cheerful?"

transcript.author: Neil
transcript.text: 'Not my cup of tea' by the way, is something you don't enjoy doing.

transcript.author: Rob
transcript.text: OK – 'ceremony' – a formal event performed on special occasions.

transcript.author: Neil
transcript.text: "I didn't go to my sister's graduation ceremony."

transcript.author: Rob
transcript.text: "In the UK, the opening of Parliament is a ceremonious occasion." Ceremonious is the adjective.

transcript.author: Neil
transcript.text: Number three – 'fancy dress' is special clothing you wear to an event – for example, to look like a famous person or character from a movie.

transcript.author: Rob
transcript.text: "I've been invited to a fancy dress party."

transcript.author: Neil
transcript.text: Who are you going to go as, Rob?

transcript.author: Rob
transcript.text: It's a secret, Neil!

transcript.author: Neil
transcript.text: Number four – ‘costume' – a set of clothes you wear to look like somebody else. "Rob is going to go to the fancy-dress party in a Superman costume."

transcript.author: Rob
transcript.text: Good guess. Right. Number five – 'to go all out' means to make a big effort.

transcript.author: Neil
transcript.text: "We went all out this year with our Christmas decorations – with a life-size flashing Santa Claus and sleigh."

transcript.author: Rob
transcript.text: Way to go, Neil! Number six – the phrasal verb 'to get carried away' – means to get very excited and lose control of your feelings!

transcript.author: Neil
transcript.text: "She got carried away and painted the whole house pink."

transcript.author: Rob
transcript.text: That must be Barbie's house…

transcript.author: Neil
transcript.text: Yup – and fancy dress is definitely Barbie's cup of tea! OK, that's all for today. But please remember to check out our Instagram, Twitter, Facebook and YouTube pages.

transcript.author: Rob
transcript.text: OK. Bye-bye!

transcript.author: Neil
transcript.text: Goodbye!
